title: How to Make a No‐Sew No‐Glue Barbie Doll Top

steps.headline: Pick out some fabric of your choice.
steps.description: For example, latex fabric, nylon, cotton fabric, or old clothes. You can use up scraps of fabric that are in your craft basket pile.

steps.headline: Cut enough fabric to fit around your doll's torso.
steps.description: Leave about 1 or 2 centimeters extra. for the Velcro piece to be attached. Use a measuring tape to get the correct measurements.

steps.headline: Add a strip of stick-on Velcro.
steps.description: Measure and cut the Velcro to the right size. Stick the ends of the strip to the cut piece of fabric where it needs to be joined.

steps.headline: Tie a ribbon around the doll's waist.
steps.description: This will make the top look even more stylish.

methods.name: Strapless Top or Dress Using a Sock or Legging

steps.headline: Find an unwanted sock or old legging.
Cut part of the leg off the sock or legging.
steps.description: The piece should fit the doll's torso. You can cut a longer piece to make a dress for your doll.

steps.headline: Cut one side of the piece so that it can be laid flat.
steps.description: Measure it around your doll and cut off the excess fabric.

steps.headline: Measure, then add a strip of Velcro at each end.
Cut the fabric into a half circle.
steps.description: Ensure that the semi-circle is big enough to wrap around the doll's torso.

steps.headline: Lay the doll on the half circle (curve facing down).
steps.description: The doll's arms should be just above the half circle. Take the two ends and from underneath the doll's arms, pull it over the doll's shoulders and to the doll's back.

steps.headline: Attach pieces of Velcro to the ends and fasten around the neck.
steps.description: You could also use Velcro to fasten the ends to the doll's back.

methods.name: Tank or Dress Using a Sock

steps.headline: Find a sock and cut the leg off.
steps.description: Leave some extra fabric on top.

steps.headline: Use a pen and trace out some long straps attached by a neckline or curve.
steps.description: The part should be big enough to cover the doll's chest. Next to each strap, draw a line that goes around the whole leg (of the sock).

steps.headline: Cut it out and put it on your doll.
steps.description: Tie the straps around the doll's neck.

text: Strapless Top Using Fabric Pick out some fabric of your choice. For example, latex fabric, nylon, cotton fabric, or old clothes. You can use up scraps of fabric that are in your craft basket pile. Cut enough fabric to fit around your doll's torso. Leave about 1 or 2 centimeters extra. for the Velcro piece to be attached. Use a measuring tape to get the correct measurements. Add a strip of stick-on Velcro. Measure and cut the Velcro to the right size. Stick the ends of the strip to the cut piece of fabric where it needs to be joined. Embellish the top with decorations.  Tie a ribbon around the doll's waist. This will make the top look even more stylish. Strapless Top or Dress Using a Sock or Legging Find an unwanted sock or old legging.  Cut part of the leg off the sock or legging. The piece should fit the doll's torso. You can cut a longer piece to make a dress for your doll. Cut one side of the piece so that it can be laid flat. Measure it around your doll and cut off the excess fabric. Measure, then add a strip of Velcro at each end. Finish by embellishing it. Velcro Vest Pick out some fabric.  Cut the fabric into a half circle. Ensure that the semi-circle is big enough to wrap around the doll's torso. Lay the doll on the half circle (curve facing down). The doll's arms should be just above the half circle. Take the two ends and from underneath the doll's arms, pull it over the doll's shoulders and to the doll's back. Attach pieces of Velcro to the ends and fasten around the neck. You could also use Velcro to fasten the ends to the doll's back. Tank or Dress Using a Sock Find a sock and cut the leg off. Leave some extra fabric on top. Use a pen and trace out some long straps attached by a neckline or curve. The part should be big enough to cover the doll's chest. Next to each strap, draw a line that goes around the whole leg (of the sock). Cut it out and put it on your doll. Tie the straps around the doll's neck.
